main event: An unidentified aerial object was observed flying over Hindsville, Arkansas on 10th August 1949 by a 73-year-old woman. The object appeared to be the size of the full moon, was round, bright, and reflecting light like aluminum, flying from west to east at a speed similar to that of an airplane. It disappeared when the observer briefly went inside her house and then returned to the yard.
interesting points: The object was bright aluminum in color and had a flat, round shape resembling a disc.
It was observed at a 45-degree angle above the horizon, approximately one mile away from the observer.
The observer was a 73-year-old woman whose character and integrity were vouched for by three neighbors, indicating a credible witness.
No sound or odor was associated with the object, and it did not leave a trail. The object's flight was level and consistent, without any maneuvers.
Approximately ten minutes after the sighting, a small black aircraft was observed flying over the area, unrelated to the initial object.
sighted object: a large, bright aluminum object in the sky resembling a disc
